meanings.definition: Say or estimate that (a specified thing) will happen in the future or will be a consequence of something.
meanings.sent1: I can predict the weather by looking at the clouds.
meanings.sent2: She predicts that it will rain tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to predict when the next meal would be served.
meanings.sent4: His experience in the field allows him to predict market trends accurately.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller predicted my future with eerie accuracy.

meanings.definition: Foretell or prophesy what will happen.
meanings.sent1: The old man can predict the outcome of any game.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient cultures believed in prophets who could predict events.
meanings.sent3: The magic eight ball tried to predict the lottery numbers.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams seemed to predict major life events.
meanings.sent5: The seer's visions always predict the fate of the kingdom.
